reviewText:
Great movie.  Sadly, not burned on M-DISC

I completely understand that less known movies like this do not economically justify pressing a disc.  However, I would've gladly paid a dollar more for a disc that would last forever.  Instead, they burned the movie on the old-fashioned, purple dye type disc that are only good for around 5 - 7 years. M-Discs last 100s of years.

Above-average World War II naval/spy/romance.  Edward G Robinson is one of the finest actors Hollywood has ever produced.  Lynn Bari, was a film actress who specialized in playing sultry, statuesque, man-killers.  She does not disappoint.  During WWII, according to a survey taken of GIs, Bari was the second-most popular pinup girl after the much better-known Betty Grable.

Lynn Bari was a staunch Republican, Bari actively supported conservative causes, campaigned for Republican presidential candidates from Hoover to Reagan, and was a regular attendee of GOP national conventions.

I'm glad to have this terrific movie in my Blu-ray/DVD collection.
Fantastic picture with a wonderful story. Edward Robinson is of course just swell,I really really enjoyed this. Picture quality and audio is near perfect.
Entertaining WWII picture.  A little strange to see Lyn Bari marrying Edward G. but over all a good picture.

This is more of a World War 2 romance and spy melodrama, rather than a shipboard story, since most of the action takes place during shore leave in Mexico.  Model shots appear to be a T2 or T3 oiler.  On board shots are either a set, or a very few on an actual oiler or freighter.  German U-boat is also a model or set.

Awesome movie.  Surprise ending!!!!!  So glad that these are being reproduced for Classic movies fans.
Very clear crisp copy.  Great acting.  If you like classic movies, you will really enjoy this.

Edward G. Robinson, Great Actor and this movie was great from start to finish. NOTE:  i am not , don't claim to be and never want to be a movie critic. so don't waste your time telling me how bad my review was, Because Frankly, I Don't Give a damn. Thank you.

This is a WW2 Marchant Marine drama centering around a ship's captain played be Edward G. robinson and the 1st Mate played by Victor Mclaglan. The ship, a tanker, is assigned to pick up a load of oil at the port of Tampico and bring it back to the USA. Enroute the ship is torpedoed and lost. The captain "retires" to Tampico and buys a home but secretly works with agents to unmask the spys responsible for the loss of his ship. He is embroiled in all sorts of trouble including a wife he suspects of being a spy. Eventually the truth comes out and the bad guys brought to justice. Good movie but don't expect an Academy Award winner...good picture and sound.......I liked it but it's not a "classic".
